update.description:
The manager interface is based on on [this wiki page](https://osrfoundation.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/GAZ/pages/11599873/Ignition+Sensors) and the Gazebo sensors manager.

The `Manager` loads `Sensor`s as plugins. Sensors are initialized from a `<sensor>` tag. Anyone can write a custom sensor plugin, but there will also be built-in plugins. The only built-in plugin in this PR is a camera plugin. Lastly there is a `save_image` example which uses a camera sensor and to save a png.


TODO for future PRs:

* Port the Distortion class
* Update SDF to support more camera parameters via SDF (antialiasing, verticalFOV)
* Support removing a camera from the ignition rendering scene
* Where do frames come in?
* What to do with `<always_on>` tag?
* How should `<visualize>` be handled?
* Unit tests for `CameraConfig`
* Find a sensor by name
* `CameraConfig` should have `FromSDF()` and `CameraSensor` should use it.
* `CameraConfig` should include pixel format when writing `ToSDF()`
* Camera should do something with `<noise>` and `<lens>`
update.title: Manager with Camera sensor and example

pull_request.title: Manager with Camera sensor and example

update.description:
The manager interface is based on on [this wiki page](https://osrfoundation.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/GAZ/pages/11599873/Ignition+Sensors) and the Gazebo sensors manager.

The `Manager` loads sensors from an `sdf::ElementPtr` of the `<sensor>` tag. Sensors are loaded dynamically, and there is code in the manager to load built-in plugins to go with the sensors in the 1.6 SDF spec.  The built-in plugins are loaded dynamically (rationale: pay only for what you use, and dogfood the same code which would load custom sensor plugins). The only plugin in this PR is the `CameraSensor` which takes a picture of an ignition rendering scene. Lastly there is a `save_image` example which loads a camera sensor and saves a png.

Some other stuff:

* Added dependency on ignition-common0 for Time
* Lots of CMake stuff, most of it to get targets to propagate requirements to other targets that depend on them
* Use GenerateExportHeader to create a header with visibility macros
* Added interface target `${PROJECT_LIBRARY_TARGET_NAME}_headers` to make it easier to get the include directory for generated headers to targets within this project
* Some cleanup in TestUtils.cmake to link using target names instead of library names where possible


Not done in this PR / TODO for future PRs:

* Port the Distortion class
* More camera parameters via SDF (antialiasing, verticalFOV
* Support removing a camera from the scene
* Where do frames come in?
* What to do with `<always_on>` tag?
* How should `<visualize>` be handled?
* Unit tests for `CameraConfig`
* Find a sensor by name
* `CameraConfig` should include pixel format in `ToSDF()`
* Camera should do something with `<noise>` and `<lens>`
update.title: Manager with Camera sensor and example

content.raw: Fixed by making `Init()` non-virtual and removing it from `CameraSensor` in 5b441de. Rationale is if a sensor needs to initialize itself it already has `Load()`, so `Init()` is unnecessary.
content.html: Fixed by making Init() non-virtual and removing it from CameraSensor in 5b441de. Rationale is if a sensor needs to initialize itself it already has Load(), so Init() is unnecessary.

pull_request.title: Manager with Camera sensor and example

update.description:
The manager interface is based on on [this wiki page](https://osrfoundation.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/GAZ/pages/11599873/Ignition+Sensors) and the Gazebo sensors manager.

The `Manager` loads sensors from an `sdf::ElementPtr` of the `<sensor>` tag. Sensors are loaded dynamically, and there is code in the manager to load built-in plugins to go with the sensors in the 1.6 SDF spec.  The built-in plugins are loaded dynamically (rationale: pay only for what you use, and dogfood the same code which would load custom sensor plugins). The only plugin in this PR is the `CameraSensor` which takes a picture of an ignition rendering scene. Lastly there is a `save_image` example which loads a camera sensor and saves a png.

Some other stuff:

* Added dependency on ignition-common0 for Time
* Lots of CMake stuff, most of it to get targets to propagate requirements to other targets that depend on them
* Use GenerateExportHeader to create a header with visibility macros
* Added interface target `${PROJECT_LIBRARY_TARGET_NAME}_headers` to make it easier to get the include directory for generated headers to targets within this project
* Some cleanup in TestUtils.cmake to link using target names instead of library names where possible


Not done in this PR / TODO for future PRs:

* Port the Distortion class
* More camera parameters via SDF
* Support removing a camera from the scene
* Where do frames come in?
* What to do with `<always_on>` tag?
* How should `<visualize>` be handled?
* Support removing sensors from a manager

content.raw: I'd vote to keep `ImageSaver` here until it becomes more useful. Right now it's justs a wrapper around counter incrementing a file name. The important stuff is in `ignition::common::Image` already.
content.html: I'd vote to keep ImageSaver here until it becomes more useful. Right now it's justs a wrapper around counter incrementing a file name. The important stuff is in ignition::common::Image already.

pull_request.title: Manager with Camera sensor and example

update.description:
The manager interface is based on on [this wiki page](https://osrfoundation.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/GAZ/pages/11599873/Ignition+Sensors) and the Gazebo sensors manager.

The `Manager` loads sensors from an `sdf::ElementPtr` of the `<sensor>` tag. Sensors are loaded dynamically, and there is code in the manager to load built-in plugins to go with the sensors in the 1.6 SDF spec.  The built-in plugins are loaded dynamically (rationale: pay only for what you use, and dogfood the same code which would load custom sensor plugins). The only plugin in this PR is the `CameraSensor` which takes a picture of an ignition rendering scene. Lastly there is a `save_image` example which loads a camera sensor and saves a png.

Some other stuff:

* Added dependency on ignition-common0 for Time
* Lots of CMake stuff, most of it to get targets to propagate requirements to other targets that depend on them
* Use GenerateExportHeader to create a header with visibility macros
* Added interface target `${PROJECT_LIBRARY_TARGET_NAME}_headers` to make it easier to get the include directory for generated headers to targets within this project
* Some cleanup in TestUtils.cmake to link using target names instead of library names where possible


Not done in this PR / TODO for future PRs:

* Port the Distortion class
* More camera parameters via SDF
* Support removing a camera from the scene
* Where do frames come in?
* What to do with `<always_on>` tag?
* How should `<visualize>` be handled?
* Support removing sensors from a manager
update.title: Manager with Camera sensor and example

content.html:
This if statement can be simplified to:

auto angle = _sdf->Get<ignition::math::Angle>("horizontal_fov", 0);
if (angle.first < 0.01 || angle.first > M_PI*2)
{
    ignerr << "..."
    return false;
}

content.raw:
In this case, you probably want to force a sensor implementation to define the `Init` function. You could make a pure virtual `InitImpl` function in Sensor. Then, `Sensor::Init` would call `DerivedSensor::InitImpl`. 

You could do the same for `Sensor::Load`.
content.html:
In this case, you probably want to force a sensor implementation to define the Init function. You could make a pure virtual InitImpl function in Sensor. Then, Sensor::Init would call DerivedSensor::InitImpl.

You could do the same for Sensor::Load.

pullrequest.title: Manager with Camera sensor and example

content.raw:
I left it out of `src/camera` because its symbols are in the library `ignition-sensors0`. I'm hoping to use the directory structure to communicate that the files in `src/camera` are part of `ignitions-sensors4-camera`. Maybe it would be clearer if this file was moved to `src/camera` and files part of the camera library were one level deeper `src/camera/lib`?

Side note, this file will be replaced by `CameraConfig.cc`.
content.html:
I left it out of src/camera because its symbols are in the library ignition-sensors0. I'm hoping to use the directory structure to communicate that the files in src/camera are part of ignitions-sensors4-camera. Maybe it would be clearer if this file was moved to src/camera and files part of the camera library were one level deeper src/camera/lib?

Side note, this file will be replaced by CameraConfig.cc.
